title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The current implementation of BidiUtil in the win32 version of SWT uses Class.forName() to initialize a static Callback object. This line of code is causing a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB: The usage of Class.forName() in BidiUtil should be removed to resolve the NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Attempt to run the application that utilizes BidiUtil.
3. Observe the NoClassDefFoundError caused by the Class.forName() usage in BidiUtil.

To fix the issue:
1. Remove the line of code that initializes the Callback object using Class.forName() in BidiUtil.
